keyTakeAways: Ford is recalling over 290,000 U.S. vehicles (2020–2022 F-250 SD, F-350 SD, and F-450 SD models) due to potential rearview camera malfunctions in specific lighting conditions, which could increase crash risk.
The issue stems from improper image display in certain lighting, which may impair driver visibility and lead to unsafe driving situations.
As of September 20, 2025, Ford had received 10 customer reports, with the first occurring in January 2022, but no reports of accidents or injuries have been documented.
Ford will provide a free software update to fix the image processing module issue through dealerships.
Interim letters will be sent to vehicle owners on October 20, 2025, with final letters to be issued in March 2026 when the final remedy is available.
Affected owners can contact Ford customer service at 1-866-436-7332 or the NHTSA safety hotline at 1-888-327-4236 or visit www.nhtsa.gov for more information.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ford is recalling over 290,000 U.S. light-duty trucks—specifically 2020 to 2022 F-250 SD, F-350 SD, and F-450 SD models—due to a potential defect in the rearview camera system that may fail to display images properly under certain lighting conditions, which could increase the risk of crashes. The recall is based on 10 customer reports, with the first dating back to January 2022, though no accidents or injuries have been reported. Ford will provide a free software update to fix the image processing module flaw through dealerships; interim letters to owners are expected on October 20, 2025, and the final remedy will be available by March 2026. Consumers can contact Ford customer service or the NHTSA safety hotline for more information.
title: Ford Recalls Over 290,000 Trucks Due to Rearview Camera Display Issues
